title: Daily added sugar intake in England in 2008 - 2012 , by age group
summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Age Group, and Sugar intake in grams in each Age Group on the y axis.
The Sugar intake in grams is highest at Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years and lowest at Age Group Children 1.5-3 years.
The difference of Sugar intake in grams between the highest and lowest Age Group is 38.1.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Age Group in the x axis and Sugar intake in grams in the y axis.
The Sugar intake in grams is highest at Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years and lowest at Age Group Children 1.5-3 years.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Age Group, and Sugar intake in grams in each Age Group on the y axis.
The Sugar intake in grams is highest at Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years and lowest at Age Group Children 1.5-3 years.

max_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Age Group, and Sugar intake in grams in each Age Group on the y axis.
The maximum Sugar intake in grams 74.2 is found at Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years and the minimum is found at Children 1.5-3 years where Age Group is 36.1.
The highest Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years has 38.1 more Sugar intake in grams than the lowest Age Group Children 1.5-3 years.
Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years is higher than any other Age Groups with value 74.2, followed by , and Adults 19-64 years. Down to Age Group Children 1.5-3 years with the lowest value 36.1.
Considered together, the average Sugar intake in grams in all 5 Age Groups is roughly 56.3.
Summing up the values of all Age Groups, we get total 281.5.
